content: I've revised the tag "Bruteforce" to "Brute-force" because the latter is the one used for all other puzzles which have such a tag.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Its good

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I dislike this kind of expected output. If you are wrong, you don't get a single hint why.

But it is good enough.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Although the wording could be better, in the end all needed info is there

Maybe it could be made clearer that production *only* comes from Blue links, while happiness both come from the "objects" themselves *and* from Green & Red links. But in the end, the info is indeed present

Also, I'm not a big fan of the "object" naming, was there something wrong with "building" ?

Still good enough for approval IMO !

Goal section
* Does the html code serve any purpose? Can only the relevant links be shown?

Input section
* Please format N and L as [[variables]].

Output section
* Please fix the typo: "posible" => "possible".

Constraints section
* Please format N as a [[variable]].

Cases
* Some cases are the same. Please revise them.

I'm trying to understand the statement... There may be more comments coming up.

Thanks.

Thanks 5DN1L
I want to place a picture in the Goal section, but I don't know how.
It is easier to understand the statement when there is visualization.

Unfortunately, embedding images is only possible if the contribution is made with CodinGame SDK https://github.com/CodinGame/codingame-sdk-doc

Examples:
https://www.codingame.com/ide/puzzle/rush-hour
https://www.codingame.com/ide/puzzle/git-patchwork

Hence, the only workaround in your case is to include the physical link of the image.

Goal section
* Please change "colony" to "city" (2 times) for consistency.

* Please change "a House type" to "of House type" or "a House type object".

* Please change "become" to "becomes".

* The following are a repetition of the explanation in the paragraphs above and may be removed?
House does nothing.
Entertainment +1 happiness.
Factory -1 happiness.
The edges of a graph have an effect depending on the type of nodes they connect.
House - Factory +1 production.
House - Entertainment +1 happiness.
Factory - Entertainment -1 happiness.
Same type objects - do nothing.
You should place objects to nodes to get the maximum production of the city. But a city happiness cannot be negative.

* Instead of the above repetition, would it be possible to add this to the statement as an illustrated example: the configuration which enables an output of 4 in the first test case (Civilization stage, small city 1)?

Thanks.

The example in Goal section looks good! Some minor comments:

* Please fix the typos:
  • "cofiguration" => "configuration"
  • "pruduction" => "production" (2 times)

* Suggest to add "(2 blue links)" after "2 production", and "(1 Entertainment + 1 green link - 1 factory)" after "(+1 happiness)" (similar to the explanation given for the first object placement).

Thanks.
